dummy_rover module¶

error_checking module¶

Small module for ensuring that we can execute the requested command. This should really be refactored into the main code.

error_checking.is_valid_command(laser_status, spec_status, active_errors, cmd)¶

Task: checks if the command sent is a valid command Inputs: int for laser status, int for spectrometer status, 21X1 boolean array for active errors, bytes for command Returns: Boolean of whether it’s a valid command

file_manager module¶

file_manager.py Logging, saving spectrometer samples If you need to save a file please use/call functions here

Basic file hierarchy for Oasis:

OASIS_SD_PATH/ (This is all on the SD card)

|- logs/ | + [All of our status logs] 0.statlog, 1.statlog, 2.statlog, 3.statlog… |- samples/ | + [All of our spectrometer samples] file extension: .bin | Spectrometer samples are named using the UNIX timestamp they were taken at as well as the fractional amount of seconds (just pass in time.time(), don’t cast to an int) |- debug/ | + [Any debug logs generated, probably unused]

OASIS_FLASH_PATH/ (This is all on the flash memory)

|- To be decided…

manifest.log Format

Each line in manifest.log corresponds to the number of .dat file (For example, the first line corresponds to file 0.dat, second line corresponds to 1.dat, fourth line corresponds to 3.dat…) Each line contains the UNIX timestamp that the sample was taken at The order that samples occured in can be deduced through a combination of the file #, and the UNIX timestamp.

This means that if two files have the same timestamp, the file with a lower file # was taken first.

class file_manager.FileManager(sd_path, flash_path)¶

Bases: object

Task: After the spectrometer finishes sampling, it will send the data to this function to be saved. Inputs: 1) a string in the format [timestamp].[file extension], 2) the 2 by 3648 data array from the spectrometer, 3) the time of the sample Outputs: integer, 0 for success, other numbers for failure to save file (for debugging purposes)

laserio module¶

main module¶

oasis_config module¶

config.py This module holds all global constants that may change frequently. This is meant to be a configuration file that any script can pull from. It is to be lightweight and contain only constants.

repeated_timer module¶

Taken from: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/474528/what-is-the-best-way-to-repeatedly-execute-a-function-every-x-seconds#474543 Allows for a timer to be set every _interval_ seconds to execute a function.

class repeated_timer.RepeatedTimer(interval, function, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

RepeatedTimer calls a function every _interval_ seconds until stop() is called.

start()¶

Starts running _function_ every _interval_ seconds. Can be stopped with stop()

stop()¶

Stops running the timer. Can be started again with start()

roverio module¶

roverio.py Manages commands that interact with the Rover. Such as: pinging, status request, transferring samples.

class roverio.Rover(oasis_serial, filemanager)¶

Bases: object

This class really doesn’t represent the Rover at all. It’s just a neat way to organize a bunch of methods. This should really be refactored.

all_spectrometer_data()¶

Task: sends all spectrometer data to the rover Returns: integer, 0 for success, other numbers for failure to open file (for debugging purposes)

clock_sync()¶

Called when the CLOCK SYNC command code is received. Sets the system clock to the received UNIX timestamp.

get_status_array(laser_status, spec_status, temp_data, efdc, error_codes, prev_cmd)¶

Task: Organizes all the status logs into a byte array Inputs:

An integer laser_status An integer spec_status A float array temp_data An int (0-255) array efdc (etch foil duty cycle) A boolean array error_codes A byte prev_cmd

Return: A bytearray of status log

ping()¶

Task: sends a response to the rover. Input: An OasisSerial object Returns: a boolean value, True for success and False for unsuccessful

send_cmd_rejected_response(laser_status, spec_status, active_errors, prev_cmd)¶

Task: sends the command rejected response for roverio Input: int for laser status, int for spectrometer status, 21X1 boolean array for active errors, bytes for prev_cmd Returns: None

status_dump()¶

Task: dumps all the status file information to the rover Inputs:

status_request(laser_status, spec_status, temp_data, efdc, error_codes, prev_cmd)¶

Task: sends back a byte list of status data (in accordance to table III in rover commands) Inputs: A byte array of status logs Returns: integer, 0 for success, other numbers for failure to send data

transfer_sample()¶

Sends the two most recent spectrometer sample files. Returns: 0 for successful completion, 1 for error

spectrometerio.py Manages communication with the spectrometer through the SeaBreeze library.

Bases: object

Class for interacting with the spectrometer through seabreeze.

sample(milliseconds)¶

tlc module¶

tlc.py Handling communication and data processing with the Thermal Logic Controller (TLC)

class tlc.TLC(serial_connection)¶

Bases: object

Class to handle communication and data collection of the Thermal Logic Controller (TLC).

get_data()¶

Returns a tuple representing the most recent data from the TLC. A tuple: array of floats of temperatures in Kelvin, array of integers of duty cycle (0 to 255), and the timestamp of the last update

get_duty_cycles()¶

Returns an array of unsigned integers (0-255) representing the PWM duty cycle set on each heater

get_temperatures()¶

Returns an array of floats representing the temperatures of the thermisters in Kelvin

ping()¶

Sends a PING command to the TLC

tlc.read_tlc_stream(tlc)¶

Thread loop that continuously reads the stream of serial data from the TLC
